column4: Is it gurb or ubuntu's fault that it cannot see symlinks to a kernel in /boot?
grub*
hmm.. in gentoo they had a symlink from /boot/boot to /boot for some reason. :P not sure why..
strange how I set symlinks to bzImage and system.map, didnot see the files on boot
i think ive seen similer things done befor....
so it's a grub thing then, not used grub for a while, seems only likes the file not a link
i think ive seen other disrtos use symlinks befor
yer, lilo
gentoo uses a symlink to boot even..  and it worked with grub.
weird then because the copies only work, not the symlinks
what filesystem is /boot on for you?
reiserfs
Bingo. :P
i think grub has an issue with reiserfs -- at least i recall it having an issue in the past.
I always wondered way some people use cp instead of ln -s for there kernel files
i just make the boot menus use the actual file names. :P
that explains it
its diffrent for diffrent people depending on their video card/hardware
I need to know where the H/V refresh is in ubuntu xorg.conf
where its at in the file? or what its settings are?
where it's at
My mums xorg.conf refresh settings when missing on a update
ok ,thanks
